channel.title: Healthy Hacker
channel.description: Welcome to the Healthy Hacker where we talk about programming, puzzles, memory, fitness, diet, and everything else that you, a healthy hacker, find interesting.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Healthy Hacker
channel.itunes:author: Chris Hunt
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to the Healthy Hacker where we talk about programming, puzzles, memory, fitness, diet, and everything else that you, a healthy hacker, find interesting.

item.title: 1: Talking about a text editor
item.author: chris@healthyhacker.com (Chris Hunt)
item.description:
This week we talk about my favorite text editor and why you should have a favorite text editor as well. There really is no reason to be using crap because everyone else uses it. This text is fake by the way, just trying to get something on the screen.

Workout of the week

Time to beat: 7 minutes, 30 seconds

The “pyramid”. This is an awesome workout because you can do it anywhere. I did this yesterday morning in 7 minutes and 15 seconds.

  • Pushup
  • Shoulder press (no weight)
item.content:encoded:
This week we talk about my favorite text editor and why you should have a favorite text editor as well. There really is no reason to be using crap because everyone else uses it. This text is fake by the way, just trying to get something on the screen.

The “pyramid”. This is an awesome workout because you can do it anywhere. I did this yesterday morning in 7 minutes and 15 seconds.

  • Pushup
  • Shoulder press (no weight)

item.title: 4: We are the healthy hackers
item.author: chris@healthyhacker.com (Chris Hunt)
item.description:
This is the short summary. It should appear in the posts listing on the index page. It can be long and wrap a bit. Maybe a bit more though cause that didn’t wrap.

This & that.

Workout of the week

3 rounds, as fast as possible, of:

  • 15 push-ups
  • 15 dips
  • 1 mile run

Tip of the week

Do things well.
item.content:encoded:
This is the short summary. It should appear in the posts listing on the index page. It can be long and wrap a bit. Maybe a bit more though cause that didn’t wrap.

This & that.

item.title: 3: This is a post about stuff
item.author: chris@healthyhacker.com (Chris Hunt)
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory - edit this post and re-build (or run with the -w switch) to see your changes! To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention: YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo.
